file_content.text: Watch out, okay? This place isn't good for people like you.
So. You made it back.
Jedi. You made it back.
Hey, Republic. You made it back.
Guess I was right about what those mercs did to Thoma. What's the story?
Thoma's dead, but he left behind a holorecording. Listen to him. Get off Nar Shaddaa.
He wanted you to be a Jedi.
I'm not a Jedi. I'm just... damn it. I'll go to Coruscant. Damn stupid Padawan, I'll go.
Wish me luck. And thank you for everything.
Thoma got himself killed, but the mercenaries won't hurt anyone else. He also left this for you.
It's over. I found his things.
A holorecording? I don't know if I even want to watch this. But thanks.
The mercenaries are dead.
That's it, then. All over.
Time for my money.
This is all I've got. It's yours.
He was a good man. Drink to him if you get the chance--but don't follow his example.
Thoma's gone because of those mercenaries. Do what you have to.
Hey. You guys are Republic, right? Hold up a minute.
Hey. You're a Jedi, right? Not a wannabe with a lightsaber, not a Padawan, but a real Jedi?
Hey, soldier. You're Republic, right? On leave, or whatever?
Hey. I hear things about you--you're Republic, right?
Shift starts in ten minutes, Neiya!
Go on, I'm on my way.
Look, I don't want money or a pass off Nar Shaddaa. A friend of mine's dead, and I want revenge.
I think you misunderstand what a Jedi does. I can't help you.
"Revenge" isn't our way.
It's a terrible thing to lose a friend, but revenge is never an answer.
I'm sorry, but I can't help.
Jedi protect their own, right? That's all this is about.
I'm Republic Special Forces. I'm not for hire.
I'm not a mercenary.
But the Republic protects its people, right? Just listen.
Sorry, lady--you want a bounty hunter, not me.
Revenge isn't my business.
Sure, if I could afford a bounty hunter... but this is Republic business. Listen.
Talk to me. Who's your friend?
What happened?
Revenge takes a toll on the spirit--and the bank account. But everything has a price.
That's a costly request.
Nothing's free on Nar Shaddaa. Especially not revenge.
That's a pricey request.
I know the way it works. I don't have much, but you'll want in on this, too.
I met a guy a few weeks back. Sweet, stupid. He was a Jedi Padawan on a mission, but we spent some time together.
He said I was Force sensitive. Now, I figure that's garbage, but he talked about getting me to the Jedi for training. It was... nice.
If your friend was right, the Jedi Order will take you in.
I can help you with that.
You're missing the point.
It's a good thing, having someone to believe in you.
I can understand that.
Yeah. Weird, at least.
This Padawan is dead?
You're testing my patience.
He went off on his "mission" a little while back. Something about alien mercenaries trained by the Empire for a special job.
I haven't heard from him. It'd be nice if he survived, but better odds the aliens cut him to pieces. So... someone needs to hurt them back.
If this Padawan was onto something, I'll check it out. But not for revenge.
I'll investigate the threat.
Good enough for me.
Your friend might still be alive. I'll try to find him.
Don't give up hope.
Okay. I hope you're right.
Those mercenaries are going to wish they'd taken a different job.
I can make them hurt.
Sounds perfect.
There are these barracks where the Empire keeps the mercs. That's where Thoma went.
If they get you, I'm not asking anyone else. Hit them like you mean it.
Hey. Hey--I'm working now, but I'm on break later. I want to talk.
This Padawan is dead?
I can help you with that.
I can help you with that.
I can understand that.
I can understand that.
This Padawan is dead?
This Padawan is dead?
This Padawan is dead?
This Padawan is dead?
You're testing my patience.
You're testing my patience.
I'll investigate the threat.
I'll investigate the threat.
Don't give up hope.
Don't give up hope.
I can make them hurt.
I can make them hurt.
He wanted you to be a Jedi.
He wanted you to be a Jedi.
It's over. I found his things.
It's over. I found his things.
